class_notes:
OPUS waitlist activates at the beginning of add/drop/swap.


(Prior completion of Psyc 110, 111, or AP/IB credit in Psychology.) (This is a survey course covering psychological theory, history, and research in the area of personality. Topics such as controversies in the field of personality assessment, cognitive and biological influences on personality, genetics and personality and gender differences in personality will be covered.)
course_description: Key concepts of several major theories of personality and their application to the study of the individual, along with techniques available for the assessment of personality.
schedule_location: MW 1pm-2:15pm in New Psyc Bldg 230 (36 Eagle Ro
sections: Class Nbr: 3626, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: J. Barber, Status: Open
